intro: Chaerophyllum infestum, commonly known as the common hedge parsley. It is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wet meadows, stream banks, and marshy areas. Its aromatic foliage and umbel-like inflorescence contribute to its ecological significance as a food source for various insects. The species is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
